item.title: The coolest way to exit a vehicle
item.description: In this video I show you what it looks like to run and jump off a trailer going the same speed as it moving forward. Will you just stand still on the ground? I also show you what it looks like to jump on a moving vehicle. Do you fall off or stay with it?

item.description: Spiders are stronger than you think!

item.title: Why did my glass melt in the microwave?
item.description: An experiment explains how certain types of glass can heat up and even melt in a microwave, breaking down the physics of microwaves, materials, and energy absorption.

item.title: How liquid nitrogen drives a piston ⚛️ #scientific #liquidnitrogen #engineering #discovery #learn #fblifestyle #reels
item.description: How liquid nitrogen drives a piston ⚛️ #scientific #liquidnitrogen #engineering #discovery #learn #fblifestyle #reels

item.title: What if the speed of light was slower?
item.description: In this video I show you what it would look like to slow the speed of light down to around walking speed. So with just walking around town you would experience relativistic effects. I talk about time dilation and length contraction and what it would look like to have it happen to you.

item.title: Removing chlorophyll from leaves
item.description: It's actually possible to remove the chlorophyll from leaves pretty easily.

item.title: Drawing on water
item.description: You can make your drawings animated by moving the water. It looks so surreal to watch a stick man become animated in real life. This is a new take on the dry erase marker stick figure trick. I talk about what is happening to make the dry erase marker ink float on top of the water to make these animations come to life.

item.title: Marshmallows getting their soul sucked out
item.description: I put 30 marshmallows in a vacuum chamber

item.title: This is the scariest sound in the world
item.description: The sound often called the "scariest in the world" is produced by the Aztec death whistle, an ancient instrument that creates a terrifying, human-like scream by matching the frequency of fearful human screams

item.title: Real-life Nether Portal
item.description: In this video, I show you how I made a circular Jacob's Ladder using a magnet and high voltage

item.title: Neutron star physics
item.description: In this video I show you what happens when you try to get close to 1 drop of a neutron star. I tell you how a neutron star is made and then also talk about different types of stars and show you a method that you could use to actually get very close to a small drop of a neutron star!

item.title: Can you see haidinger's brush?
item.description: This video shows how to see Haidinger's brush and what it looks like:

item.title: How does the chain fountain work?
item.description: The amazing self-siphoning chain fountain actually works. Then I show you a chain that can actually get sucked down when you drop it on a table! This is an amazing physics demonstration that was only recently discovered and finally modeled. This is similar to the molecular version of this event with the self pouring self siphoning fluid polyethylene glycol. Here is a link to the published papers on this phenomenon.
